navigation.title: Match Nouns
navigation.outcome: A fun puzzle activity where children match the identical images. In the process they learn that nouns are names of animals.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Nouns- My Body
navigation.outcome: A combined learning of body parts and also that the names of our body parts are nouns.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Noun - Person
navigation.outcome: This gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Noun - Place
navigation.outcome: Children learn the nouns as the name of places like city, park, hospital etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Noun - Animal
navigation.outcome: Children learn the nouns of animal names like, lion, bear, tiger etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Noun - Things
navigation.outcome: Children learn about names of things through two activities - filling the blanks and matching image to name.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Revision
navigation.outcome: Children revise the lessons they have learnt previosly regarding nouns.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Countable nouns
navigation.outcome: Air, water, rice etc are not countable. Children learn here about countable nouns like, apple, books, oranges, moon etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: He
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'he' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: She
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'she' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: You
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'you' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: They
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'they' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: It
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'it' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: I
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'I' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: We
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces pronoun 'we' which can replace the noun in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Revision 1
navigation.outcome: Going through the lessons the child will realize that the pronouns prevent repetition of nouns in a sentence making it compact and neat. Pronouns are important in increasing the competency of English language.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Revision - 2
navigation.outcome: Going through the lessons the child will realize that the pronouns prevent repetition of nouns in a sentence making it compact and neat. Pronouns are important in increasing the competency of English language.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Action Words - 1
navigation.outcome: Children learn about verbs with help of images. They learn about simple actions like , walk, jump, cry etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Action Words -2
navigation.outcome: Children learn about verbs with help of images. They learn about simple actions like , read, eat, see etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Past- Tense
navigation.outcome: Apart from learning verbs as words, students will know how to use them in sentences. They also learn about verbs in past tense in this lesson.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Present Tense
navigation.outcome: Apart from learning verbs as words, students will know how to use them in sentences. They also learn about verbs in presnt tense in this lesson.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Future- Tense
navigation.outcome: Apart from learning verbs as words, students will know how to use them in sentences. They also learn about verbs in future tense in this lesson.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Verbs Practice
navigation.outcome: Teaches auxillary verbs with simple sentences like I [am] a girl, You [are] tall, He [is] sick.etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences with verb in present tense
navigation.outcome: Children learn proper use of verbs in present tense in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences starting with 'the'
navigation.outcome: Most non-English speakers have trouble placing right articles in sentences since most common languages do not use articles like a, an or the in their sentences. This lesson helps children understand the right usage of article 'the' in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences with article 'a'
navigation.outcome: This lesson helps children understand the right usage of article 'a' in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences with article 'an'
navigation.outcome: This lesson helps children understand the right usage of article 'an' in a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Revision
navigation.outcome: The lesson combines the articles, 'a', 'an' and 'the' to reinforce the learning
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Demonstrative words
navigation.outcome: Teaches words, such as this/that, or these/those which are used to indicate which entities are being referred to and to distinguish those entities.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences ending in Adverbs
navigation.outcome: Adverbs are words that describe a verb. In this lesson sentences end with an adverb eg - John eats fast. The tree grows slowly.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Conjunctions
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches the use of 'and' in connecting two different words or phrases.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Opposites
navigation.outcome: Children are introduced to simple basic antonyms like tall x short, hot x cold etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sequences
navigation.outcome: Ordinal order like first, second, etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Prepositions
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches position of person or object in relation to others, like under, behind, in front of etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Prepositions 2
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches position of person or object in relation to others, like next to, under, behind, in front of etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Prepositions 3
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches position of person or object in relation to others, like under, behind, in front of etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Period -Sentence Ending
navigation.outcome: The lesson introduces children to basic punctuation of putting a period at the end ofa sentence so that they become familiar with it.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Word Space
navigation.outcome: The space between two words distinguishes and isolates them. Children learn about the space between the words in a sentence in this lesson.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Practice 1
navigation.outcome: Punctuation primarily helps to indicate the pauses and the emphasis on certain ideas or thoughts that are discussed in written text. The lesson helps children practice basic punctuations in a sentence so that they become familiar with it.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Question Mark
navigation.outcome: Introduces '?' question mark and how it appears at the end of an interrogative sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Capitalization
navigation.outcome: Teaches simple rule of Capitalizing the Proper Noun and begining of a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Fill Right Adjectives
navigation.outcome: Adjectives are descriptive words which children find very funny and interesting, but at the same time, they are not easy to understand and learn. There are extensive easy lessons in this chapter which will help students to use words to describe people, places, things, ideas, and activities of their everyday life.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Tag Adjectives
navigation.outcome: Children learn adjectives that describe feelings, taste and colours.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Write Adjectives
navigation.outcome: Children learn adjectives like big, hungry, small etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences ending with adjectives
navigation.outcome: Sometimes adjectives come after the noun in a sentence, for example 'The snake is long', 'The ball is red' etc. The lesson teaches the pattern to children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Declarative/Assertive Sentence
navigation.outcome: Children learn about the declarative sentence, which is the most common type of sentence in the English language. They understand that it is written in the present tense and usually ends with a period.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Interrogative Sentences
navigation.outcome: The lesson teaches the order of words to create a questioning sentence. Children also learn that a interrogative sentence has a question mark in the end.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Negative Sentences
navigation.outcome: Introduces sentences that states something is false. For example, 'He cannot run', 'She cannot read', 'The boy cannot walk now', etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Large Sentences
navigation.outcome: Students create larger sentences like 'They are making a castle out of sand.' and 'The old man is painting the desk white.'
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences Starting With Pronouns
navigation.outcome: Children will learn how a pronoun replaces a noun in the beginning of a sentence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Sentences starting with proper nouns
navigation.outcome: Children learn how a sentence starting with a sentence will describe the subject as the sentence progresses.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Complex sentences
navigation.outcome: Teaches complex sentences to increase the comprehension skills in students. eg - He looks happy when he drives.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Count
navigation.outcome: Improves counting skills with sentences like - Three cars, Two pails, One boy, etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Day and Night
navigation.outcome: Students learn about the activities they perform during day or night.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Night and Day
navigation.outcome: Students learn about the activities that place during day and night. For example - The sun rises in the morning.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Reading Time
navigation.outcome: Students learn to read time with help of picture puzzle.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Match Time
navigation.outcome: Children match the time with the specific clock hands in the simple gamified version of match the following.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Practice
navigation.outcome: Children fill in the blanks with answers regarding hours, minutes, seconds, days etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: More Practice
navigation.outcome: Children fill in the blanks with answers regarding months, hours, minutes, seconds, days etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Indian Currency 1
navigation.outcome: Students learn about different denominations of Indian currency and become familiar with money.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Indian Currency 2
navigation.outcome: Students learn about different denominations of Indian currency and become familiar with money.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Indian Currency 3
navigation.outcome: Students learn about different denominations of Indian currency and become familiar with money.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Indian Currency 4
navigation.outcome: Students learn about different denominations of Indian currency and become familiar with money.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Indian Currency 5
navigation.outcome: Students learn about different denominations of Indian currency and become familiar with money.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Basics
navigation.outcome: The visual images help children identify different lines and units of measurements like litre, kg etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Comparison
navigation.outcome: Children learn about the concept of big/small, fat/thin, tall/short etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: More Comparisons
navigation.outcome: More comparisons of sizes are learned.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Units of Measurement
navigation.outcome: Students are introduced to basic units of measurements.
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Parts & Whole
navigation.outcome: Students are introduced to parts of an whole object like half, quarter etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en

navigation.title: Parts & Whole 1
navigation.outcome: Students are introduced to parts of an whole object like half, quarter etc
navigation.subject: /Subject/en
